channel.title: Dietrich Ayala - Dietrich Ayala
channel.description: Internet freedom, the web and Mozilla.

item.title: Yoga: Antidote for a Developer's Achilles Heel?
item.description:
I don't have wrist/hand/finger problems... yet. As a developer, I've always seen these problems not as an "if", but a "when" thing. From the article:

"A study led by Marianne Garfinkel, Ed.D., a faculty lecturer at Hahnemann University in Philadelphia and a yoga practitioner, has given credence to the idea that certain asanas can facilitate wrist rejuvenation."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Sortware Development Conversations
item.description: Java focused, but much information is applicable to development in any language. "Part VI: Tuning Performance and Process" is especially good.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Hagenbush on Applied OO PHP: APIs, Design Patterns and Useful Objects
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Java Web Services Tutorials
item.description: Great resource, via Windley's Enterprise Computing Weblog. Includes tutorials for Glue and Axis.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Temporal Coupling, MOM and SEDA
item.description: A bunch on interesting stuff in a post from James Strachan.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: W3C Howto on 3 Column Layout with CSS
item.description: The W3C explains their new homepage design, via ,Zeldman.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Asynchronous Client API Proposal for Axis
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: What is a Knowledge Representation?
item.description: Thanks to an interesting blog entry by Joshua Allen, I was introduced to KR and KIFLink
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: RDF Primer... Primer
item.description: AaronSwartz is writing a quickie introduction to RDF. Super helpful. Has great section headings such as "Making Money with RDF", and "RDF in 5 Minutes" (take that you anti-RDF whiners). Also interspersed with links to external resources.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: For the Amateur Astronomer...
item.description: "Free Star Charts I'm sitting here listening to Science Friday on NPR about amateur astronomy. I'm beginning to get the bug to try my own hand at getting a telescope and going out to see the stars and stuff. Childhood dreams and all that. Anyway here's a pretty cool site that has some free PDF star charts to assist your nighttime explorations. [via CogWorks News]Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Interesting Papers by Stephen Mazzocchi
item.description:
Several papers relating to XML from this Cocoon developer and Apache Group member. Examples:

  • Enabling Semantic Searching

  • Reducing The Effects Of Growth Saturation With The Adoption Of A Publishing Framework Based On XML Technologies

  • Adding XML Capabilities with CocoonLink
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Are Your Couplings Loose or Tight?
item.description: Doug Kaye put up an informative table contrasting tight and loose coupling.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: NuSOAP Book Chapter Available Online
item.description: Thanks to a user on the nusoap-general list, I found that the San Francisco PHP Users Group had the chapter I wrote for Professional Open Source Web Services available for download. Upon further research, I found that WROX used my chapter as the sample chapter for the book! Download the chapter here (PDF).Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Linux on Laptops Article
item.description: "Hot Rodding Your Slightly Dated Laptop For Fun and Profit"Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala
